revised_title: Measurement of Chemical Intensity of Total Daylight During the Total Solar Eclipse of December 22nd, 1870
tldr: The authors conducted a series of measurements to determine the chemical intensity of total daylight during the total solar eclipse of December 22nd, 1870, at Catania in Sicily. They used sensitive paper coated with silver chloride to estimate the tint acquired upon exposure to daylight. The results showed that the rate of diminution of chemical action during the eclipse was greater than the area of the darkened solar disk, and less so during the exposed portion of the disk.
